==Descriptions==

Mighty ramparts defend its western edge from the corroding power of sandstorms.<br />Legend has it that many mythical creatures inhabit Sumeru's woods, and only the blessed few are lucky enough to see them.|[[Expedition]] description}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* {{Lang|''{{w|Ashavan}}''|ae=ğ¬€ğ¬´ğ¬€ğ¬¬ğ¬€ğ¬¥}} is a Zoroastrian term for "possessing/mastering truth" or "possessing/mastering righteousness". It can also be a combination of two Sanskrit words, ''Asha'' meaning "hope or life" and ''Van'' meaning "forest". ''Ashavan'' means "hopeful forest or forest with life", which is more relevant from Sumeru's perspective as compared to the word of Zoroastrian origin.
